data.title: The Baltimore City State's Attorney's Office
data.meta_site_name: The Baltimore City State's Attorney's Office
data.text:
District Court Mental Health Court (MHC) is a specially designated court docket through The Office of Problem-Solving Courts. The docket provides a consistent approach to handling cases involving defendants with mental illness. Cases can be referred to MHC at every stage of criminal proceedings, from charging through violations of probation. Cases come to MHC in three different ways, Not Criminally Responsible pleas, competency, and probation. Cases are monitored by MHC until the supervision term expires or until a Defendant is competent and the case is set for trial. The goal of MHC is to address underlying problems that contribute to criminal behavior and reduce recidivism in defendants with mental illness while preserving public safety.

Responsibilities and Duties include but are not limited to:

Creating and maintaining MHC case files, including: setting up new case files with appropriate forms and documents; procuring missing case files, charging packets, and rap sheets; preparing files returned for trial or forwarded to Circuit Court; filing reports and pleadings received; stripping closed files and scanning documents into digital case management system.

Pulling and breaking down MHC dockets; preparing and updating docket sheets

Monitoring daily email updates of the weekly dockets for additions and deletions

Assisting attorneys in collecting evidence to include body worn camera, police reports, certified records, driving records and CDS analysis as appropriate.

Collecting mail, email, filings and faxes coming to MHC

Preparing outgoing correspondence, including witness contact correspondence at the direction of the MHC attorneys

Supporting attorneys in review hearings and during court

Creating and maintaining databases, particularly Access and Excel, and prepare reports

Assisting in collecting and entering statistical data in MHC databases and spreadsheets

Filing pleadings as needed and serving various parties within MDEC

Preparing documents for Hospital Warrants and distributing pleadings as required

Basic office duties such as scanning, typing, faxing, answering phones, emailing, filing, photocopying, preparing subpoenas

Light research at the direction of the Mental Health Court Unit attorneys

Performing additional, related duties as needed and assigned

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Good oral and written communication skills

Excellent time management and organizational skills

Ability to organize and coordinate multiple priorities in a high volume and fast-paced environment in order to meet deadlines

Punctual and reliable

Familiarity with Court & SAO process and workflow preferred

Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Access, Teams & PowerPoint) as well as case management systems and court related software (CJIS, JD, JIS)

Experience with court e-filing system (MDEC) preferred

The selected candidate will be required to pass a criminal background check before starting employment.

Salary: Salary range is $40,770 - $48,225. Compensation also includes a competitive benefits package.

To Apply: Interested persons should email their resume and cover letter to resume@stattorney.org by close of business October 1, 2024 with a subject reference of Mental Health Court Office Service Assistant. Documents must be in PDF or Word format.
